entries.meaning: (Carried) on the back or the shoulders.
examples: For, as our modern wits behold, / Mounted a pick-back on the old, / Much further off; much further he / Rais'd on his aged beast, could see

verbs.description: pickaback (third-person singular simple present pickabacks, present participle pickabacking, simple past and past participle pickabacked)

entries.meaning: (transitive) Dated form of piggyback (“carry someone on the back or shoulders”).
